frame.name: Fire_emergency_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame characterizes any scenario in which the presence of a fire necessitates an emergency response in order to mitigate damage directly caused by the fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Fire
FE.definition: <def-root>The fire which causes an emergency response.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time between the declaration of a <fen>Fire</fen> as in an emergency state and the conclusion of the emergency.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the fire emergency scenario occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Responder
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or group that is responding to a fire emergency with directed action.</def-root>

FE.name: Response
FE.definition: <def-root>Directed action leading to recovery, rescue, or general mitigation of distress due to an ensuing fire emergency.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the fire emergency scenario occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen>(s) affected negatively by the fire emergency event.</def-root>
